channel.title: My mini home theater
channel.description:
Well, powersquad are going to install and do everything for me in 1 week before that happens i'd like to know if this is a good setup.
PS. This is in my 2nd room, i paid for it.
ok, SONY BRAVIA XBR 40" Yamaha yht-195
comment please

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

If I were to buy a TV with Dolby surround set they would install it for free, no matter what shop I go to. I find it strange that they don’t do that where you live.

item.title: My mini home theater
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The speakers should be in 4 corners, at about the same distance from the couch. The front ones should be a little in front, and a few meters away from the tv. They also have to point towards the couch. They also have to point towards your head when you sit. The bass module behind, or under(if there is space) the tv. The middle speaker on top of the tv (didn’t look at your tv, but it probably will fit). The attachment is a schematic location.

This is how I would place them. Maybe other people have different opinions, this is just mine. If you don’t feel comfortable with it, let the people from powersquad install it.

Read full topic

item.title: My mini home theater
item.dc:creator: @The_Wise_Guy .Kaboom
item.description:
@The_Wise_Guy wrote:

runescape3dude:

It costs $500 for two power leads an aerial cable and some speaker cables? Wow.

how about, optical cables, HDMI cables, Coax cables?You can’t just take the TV home and plug the aerial and plug the power in and away you go
There’s wall brackets, installation, cables, surge boards, set top boxes. Even something to put your TV on …[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 13, 2008, 03:03:34 am[/size][hr]This is basically my room

Read full topic

item.title: My mini home theater
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Really, it’s not worth the money (if it costs any) to have them install it. Especially if you have an easy shaped room (square, round). It’s really easy to install the stuff by yourself, and you get some knowledge from it too. It’s fun actually. If you need help, just make a paint image of the shape of your room and I’ll help with where to put the speakers.

Read full topic
